SEARCH
Module com.example.demo
Package com.example.demo.state

Class LoseState

java.lang.Object
com.example.demo.state.LoseState
All Implemented Interfaces:
GameState
public class LoseState extends Object implements GameState
The LoseState class implements the GameState interface and represents the state of the game when the player has lost. It manages the display of the lose screen and handles user input to transition to other states or exit the game.
See Also:

      public LoseState(javafx.stage.Stage stage, StateTransitioner stateTransitioner)
      Constructs a new LoseState with the specified stage and state transitioner.
      Parameters:
      stage - the stage associated with this state
      stateTransitioner - the state transitioner to manage state transitions

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the LoseState by setting up the LoseScreen and its scene. This method creates a new instance of LoseScreen, retrieves its scene, sets the scene on the stage, and then displays the stage.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface GameState

    • getScene

      public javafx.scene.Scene getScene()
      Retrieves the current scene associated with the lose state.
      Specified by:
      getScene in interface GameState
      Returns:
      the current scene

    • update

      public void update(long now)
      Updates the state of the game. This method is called periodically to update the game's state based on the current time. In the case of the lose state, no update logic is needed as the lose screen is static.
      Specified by:
      update in interface GameState
      Parameters:
      now - The current timestamp in nanoseconds.

    • handleInput

      public void handleInput(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent event)
      Handles keyboard input events when the game is in the "Lose" state.
      Specified by:
      handleInput in interface GameState
      Parameters:
      event - the KeyEvent that triggered this handler If the ENTER key is pressed, the game transitions to the main menu. If the ESCAPE key is pressed, the game window is closed.

    • cleanup

      public void cleanup()
      Cleans up resources or state when the lose screen is no longer needed. In this implementation, no cleanup is required for the static lose screen.
      Specified by:
      cleanup in interface GameState
